rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents public/anonymous users from reaching any internal business systems or data.
rules.compact_rule: IF user.is_authenticated == false THEN DENY ALL on {CRM, ProjectRegistry, EmployeeRegistry, TimeTracking, InternalWiki, InternalChatbotAPI}; ALLOW ONLY access to explicitly public marketing content.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures that any public chatbot cannot leak internal or personal data even indirectly.
rules.compact_rule: IF user.is_guest == true THEN chatbot.data_sources := {public_marketing_site, public_documents_only}; STRIP any internal identifiers (employee_id, customer_id, project_id), personal emails, salaries, internal locations, or non-public customer/project names from responses.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Defines what any employee (via chatbot) may see about other employees.
rules.compact_rule: IF requester.is_employee == true THEN ALLOW read{target.name, target.email, target.location, target.department, target.basic_role, selected(target.skills, target.wills)} VIA chatbot; DO NOT include salary or HR notes unless requester has elevated rights (see salary rule).

rules.why_relevant_summary: Protects salary and sensitive HR notes in the employee registry.
rules.compact_rule: IF field IN {employee.salary, employee.hr_notes} THEN ALLOW read/write ONLY IF requester.role IN {HRAdmin, HRDirector, ManagerOf(employee), ITAdmin(read_tech_only)}; ELSE Outcome := denied_security AND DO NOT expose value.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Restricts who may change core HR master data in the employee registry.
rules.compact_rule: IF field IN {employee.salary, employee.department, employee.reports_to} THEN ALLOW write ONLY IF requester.role IN {HRAdmin, HRDirector}; IF field IN {employee.location, employee.skills, employee.wills} THEN ALLOW write IF requester == employee OR requester.role IN {HRAdmin, ManagerOf(employee)}; ALL writes MUST record changed_by := requester.employee_id.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Enforces immutability of approved or invoiced time entries.
rules.compact_rule: IF time_entry.status IN {"approved", "invoiced"} THEN DENY direct UPDATE or DELETE by employee or chatbot; REQUIRE correction_via_designated_workflow that creates offset/voided entries and preserves audit trail.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents project leads (or an agent acting for them) from improperly submitting other people’s time.
rules.compact_rule: IF requester.role == ProjectLead AND time_entry.employee_id != requester.employee_id THEN ALLOW create_or_update(time_entry) ONLY WITH status == "draft"; DENY transition of such entries to {"submitted", "approved"} by requester.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures all customer master data lives only in the CRM and is maintained by responsible roles.
rules.compact_rule: FOR ALL customer_master_operations: CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE MUST be executed in CRM ONLY; chatbot/agents MUST NOT create "shadow" customers in other systems (e.g., wiki, spreadsheets). WRITE operations on CRM.customer are ALLOWED ONLY IF requester.role IN {SalesUser, CustomerService, SalesManager, FinanceController, ITAdmin(technical)}; account_manager is responsible for keeping phases and briefs current.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures workload and project-team changes come only from authorised project owners.
rules.compact_rule: FOR ProjectRegistry.team OR ProjectRegistry.workload UPDATES: ALLOW write ONLY IF requester.employee_id == project.manager_id OR requester.role IN {DepartmentLead, PMO, ITAdmin(maintenance)}; OTHERS: read-only access.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Requires all API access to be constrained by system roles and prevents privilege escalation by the agent.
rules.compact_rule: FOR ANY chatbot_or_agent_API_call: effective_permissions := RBAC(user.employee_id, user.system_roles, user.department, user.location); Agent MUST execute queries and mutations ONLY within effective_permissions; Agent MUST NOT assume global or admin rights unless user.role explicitly grants them.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Defines how the agent must treat security-related outcome codes from backend APIs.
rules.compact_rule: IF backend_response.Outcome == "denied_security" THEN Agent MUST NOT retry via alternative endpoints or bypass controls; MUST return an access-denied message and MAY suggest contacting the relevant system owner; IF Outcome IN {"none_unsupported", "none_clarification_needed"} THEN Agent MUST NOT fabricate data and MUST either ask user for clarification or state the limitation.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents sensitive data from being stored in the wiki via automated updates.
rules.compact_rule: FOR ANY wiki_write (create/update): IF content_contains{salaries, individual_compensation_details, confidential_HR_notes, highly_sensitive_personal_data} THEN DENY write; wiki SHOULD contain processes, guidelines and conceptual information only, not transactional HR/salary data.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Controls visibility and editing of skills & wills, which are used for staffing and HR decisions.
rules.compact_rule: ALLOW read of employee.skills and employee.wills to HR and managers for all employees; ALLOW read of selected/non-sensitive skills & wills to all employees via chatbot; ALLOW write of skills & wills ONLY by {employee_self, ManagerOf(employee), HRAdmin}; Agent MUST keep skills/wills lists sorted alphabetically by name and within allowed rating range [1..10].

rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures all changes are auditable and correctly attributed when made via an AI agent.
rules.compact_rule: FOR ANY state-changing_operation (on CRM, ProjectRegistry, EmployeeRegistry, TimeTracking, Wiki): request.payload.changed_by := requester.employee_id (or a distinct service_identity with linked end_user_id); Agent MUST NOT perform bulk or cross-user updates without explicit per-target authorisation and audit attribution.
